alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 14 at 4:24AM ChST until January 14 at 6:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CHST THIS EVENING ALONG NORTH FACING REEFS... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON ALONG NORTH AND EAST FACING REEFS... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CHST SUNDAY ALONG NORTH AND EAST FACING REEFS... * WHAT...Dangerously large breaking waves of 11 to 15 feet and dangerous rip currents expected along north and east facing reefs. * WHERE...Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan Counties. * WHEN...For the High Surf Warning, until 6 PM ChST Saturday. For the High Surf Advisory, from 6 PM Saturday to 6 PM ChST Sunday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Ritidian buoy measured 11 to 15 feet today and model projections expect a similar trend tomorrow as well. Swell is expected to turn more from the east and gradually subside Saturday afternoon into evening, downgrading to an advisory and be extended to east-facing reefs when the warning expires.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
